diagnoses: Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) (Crohns disease or ulcerative colitis)
Hereditary angioedema with normal C1 inhibitor
Brain tumor (rare, but requires medical attention)

{Migraine with Aura: Migraines can cause a variety of neurological symptoms, including weakness, nausea, phonophobia (sensitivity to sound), dysarthria (difficulty speaking), and vomiting. Aura refers to sensory disturbances that precede or accompany the headache.}, {Transient Ischemic Attack (TIA): TIAs are like mini-strokes caused by a temporary interruption of blood flow to the brain. Symptoms can include weakness, nausea, dizziness, and difficulty speaking.}, {Stroke: Strokes are medical emergencies that occur when blood flow to the brain is blocked. Symptoms can include sudden weakness, nausea, vomiting, speech problems, and vision changes.}, {Meningitis: Meningitis is an inflammation of the membranes surrounding the brain and spinal cord. Symptoms can include headache, fever, stiff neck, nausea, vomiting, and sensitivity to light and sound.}, {Encephalitis: Encephalitis is an inflammation of the brain itself, often caused by a viral infection. Symptoms can include headache, fever, confusion, seizures, and sometimes nausea and vomiting.}, {Brain Tumor: Brain tumors can cause a wide range of symptoms depending on their location and size. Symptoms can include headaches, nausea, vomiting, weakness, and changes in speech or vision.}, {Multiple Sclerosis (MS): MS is an autoimmune disease that affects the central nervous system. Symptoms can vary widely, but may include fatigue, weakness, numbness, tingling, and problems with balance and coordination.}, {Vestibular Disorders: Vestibular disorders affect the inner ear and can cause vertigo, dizziness, nausea, vomiting, and difficulty with balance.}, {Inner Ear Infection (Labyrinthitis): Labyrinthitis is an infection of the inner ear that can cause dizziness, nausea, vomiting, and hearing loss.}, {Dehydration: Severe dehydration can cause weakness, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and dizziness.}
